text: The Mission of Yahweh’s Servant
Look! \add here is\add* my servant; I hold him,
my chosen one, \add in whom\add* my soul delights.
I have ⸤put⸥\f + \fr 42:1 \ft Literally “given” \f* my spirit on him;
he will bring justice forth to the nations.
He will not cry out and lift up
and make his voice heard in the street.
He will not break a broken reed,
and he not will extinguish a dim wick.
He will bring justice forth in\f + \fr 42:3 \ft Or “to” \f* faithfulness.
He will not grow faint,
and he will not be broken
until he has established justice in the earth.
And \add the\add* coastlands wait for his teaching.
Thus says the God, Yahweh,
who created the heavens
and stretched them out,
who spread out the earth and its offspring,
who gives breath to the people upon it
and spirit to those who walk in it.
“I \add am\add* Yahweh; I have called you in righteousness,
and I have grasped your hand and watched over you;
and I have given you as a covenant of \add the\add* people,
as a light of \add the\add* nations,
to open \add the\add* blind eyes,
to bring \add the\add* prisoner out from \add the\add* dungeon,
those who sit \add in\add* darkness from \add the\add* house of imprisonment.
I \add am\add* Yahweh; that \add is\add* my name,
and I do not give my glory to another,
nor\f + \fr 42:8 \ft Or “and” \f* my praise to the idols.
Look! the former things have come,
and I declare new things.
I ⸤announce⸥\f + \fr 42:9 \ft Literally “cause to hear” \f* \add them\add* to you before they sprout up.”
A Song of Praise to Yahweh
Sing a new song to Yahweh;
praise him from the end of the earth,
you\f + \fr 42:10 \ft Or “those” \f* who go down \add to\add* the sea and that which fills it,
\add the\add* coastlands and their inhabitants.
Let \add the\add* desert and its towns lift up their voice,
\add the\add* villages \add that\add* Kedar inhabits.
Let the inhabitants of Sela sing for joy;
let them shout loudly from \add the\add* ⸤top⸥\f + \fr 42:11 \ft Literally “head” \f* of \add the\add* mountains.
Let them give\f + \fr 42:12 \ft Or “establish” \f* glory to Yahweh
and declare his praise in the coastlands.
Yahweh goes forth like a mighty warrior;
he stirs up zeal like a man of war.
He raises the war cry, indeed he raises the battle shout;
he prevails against his foes.
I have been silent for a long time;
I have kept silent;
I have restrained myself like one giving birth;
I will moan, pant, and gasp together.
I will cause mountains and hills to dry up,
and I will cause all their herbage to wither;
and I will make rivers like islands,
and I will cause pools to dry up.
And I will lead the blind by a road they do not know;
I will cause \add them\add* to tread on paths they have not known.
I will make darkness ⸤in their presence⸥\f + \fr 42:16 \ft Literally “before their face” \f* into light
and rough places into level ground.
These \add are\add* the things I will do,
and I will not forsake them.
They shall turn back;
they shall be ⸤greatly ashamed⸥,\f + \fr 42:17 \ft Literally “ashamed with shame” \f*
those who trust in an image,
who say to a cast image, “You \add are\add* our gods.”
Blind and Deaf Israel
Deaf people, listen!
And blind people, look to see!
Who \add is\add* blind but my servant
or\f + \fr 42:19 \ft Or “and” \f* deaf like my messenger \add whom\add* I sent?
Who \add is\add* blind like the one who is repaid
or\f + \fr 42:19 \ft Or “and” \f* blind like the servant of Yahweh?
You see many \add things\add*, but\f + \fr 42:20 \ft Or “and” \f* you do not observe.
\add His\add* ears are open, but\f + \fr 42:20 \ft Or “and” \f* he does not hear.
Yahweh was willing for the sake of his righteousness;
he showed \add his\add* teaching to be great and proved \add it\add* to be glorious.
But\f + \fr 42:22 \ft Or “And” \f* this \add is\add* a people plundered and looted; all of them are trapped in holes,
and they are kept hidden in houses of imprisonment.
They have become like plunder, and there is no one who saves;
\add like\add* booty, and there is no one who says, “Restore!”
Who among you will heed this,
will listen attentively and listen, for ⸤the time to come⸥?\f + \fr 42:23 \ft Literally “later” \f*
Who gave Jacob to a plunderer\f + \fr 42:24 \ft The reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) has “as plunder” \f*
and Israel to those who plunder?
\add Was it\add* not Yahweh, against whom\f + \fr 42:24 \ft Or “this” \f* we have sinned?
And they were not willing to walk in his ways,
and they would not ⸤obey⸥\f + \fr 42:24 \ft Literally “hear” \f* his law.
So\f + \fr 42:25 \ft Or “and” \f* he poured \add the\add* wrath \add of\add* his anger upon him
and \add the\add* strength of war.
And it set him afire all around, but\f + \fr 42:25 \ft Or “and” \f* he did not understand;\f + \fr 42:25 \ft Or “did not know” \f*
and it burned him, but\f + \fr 42:25 \ft Or “and” \f* he did not take \add it\add* to heart.
